questions.question_text: Which command configures IKEv2 symmetric identity authentication?
Which two examples of transform sets are contained in the IKEv2 default proposal? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Device# show crypto ikev2 proposal default
 
IKEv2 proposal: default 
Encryption: AES-CBC-256 AES-CBC-192 AES-CBC-128
Integrity: SHA512 SHA384 SHA256 SHA96 MD596
PRF: SHA512 SHA384 SHA256 SHA1 MD5
DH Group: DH_GROUP_1536_MODP/Group 5 DH_GROUP_1024_MODP/Group 2.

C 


Usage Guidelines

The no option allows inheritance of a value from another group policy. To prevent inheriting filter values, use the filter value none command.

You configure ACLs to permit or deny various types of traffic for this user or group policy. You then use the filter command to apply those ACLs for WebVPN traffic.

WebVPN does not use ACLs defined in the vpn-filter command.

questions.question_text: Which command will prevent a group policy from inheriting a filter ACL in a clientless SSL VPN?

discussion.content:
ciscoasa(config-webvpn)# hostscan image ?

webvpn mode commands/options:
boot: Cisco Hostscan package file path
disk0: Cisco Hostscan package file path
flash: Cisco Hostscan package file path

questions.question_text: Which command specifies the path to the Host Scan package in an ASA AnyConnect VPN?

choices.C: Change to an IKEvI configuration since IKEv2 does not support a full tunnel with static peers
choices.D: Change the local traffic selector on the headquarter ASA to 0.0.0.0/0
choices.A: Change the Diffie-Hellman group on the headquarter ASA to group5forthe dynamic crypto map
choices.E: Change the remote traffic selector on the headquarter ASA to 0.0.0.0/0
choices.B: Change the remote traffic selector on the remote ASA to 192.168.22.0/24

discussion.content: the answer is D, the question clearly states that all traffic must traverse the tunnel.

questions.answer_description: The traffic selector is used to determine which traffic should be protected (encrypted over the IPSec tunnel). We want this to be specific, otherwise Internet traffic will also be sent over the tunnel and most likely dropped on the remote side. Here, we just want to protect traffic from 192.168.33.0/24 to 192.168.22.0/24.
